abstract: The man who helped write Ohio's capital punishment statute said the state had a "death lottery" rather than a "death penalty."
lead_paragraph: There are 34 states that still allow capital punishment, but some attract more attention from anti-death penalty activists than others. Texas finds itself in the limelight with some frequency, since it leads the nation in sheer numbers of executions. Alabama upset a lot of people when it executed a mentally disabled man in September of 2010. Ohio didn't use to come up that often-it was considered reasonably "good at" applying the death penalty, which I mean to sound ridiculous-but that's changed.

headline.main: Death Penalty Death Watch: Trouble in Ohio
